bug.author: jlewi
bug.summary: KF1.0: No GPU Vendors Listed In UI (GCP)
bug.description:
/kind bug Here's a screen shot of the Jupyter UI in a 1.0 cluster <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/dd24e6e>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/dd24e6e</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/777219/73849282-86e9c300-47de-11ea-96d3-f138269e7a3a.png></denchmark-link>
No vendors are listed in the GPU window. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kimwnasptd>@kimwnasptd</denchmark-link> do the GPU vendors need to be listed in a configmap?

comments.comment:
Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the labels:
Label Probability
kind/bug 0.98
Please mark this comment with or to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-botdata/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> yes, I made a <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/798>PR</denchmark-link> to manifests to resolve this one but I'm having some problems with the tests.
Before we close this is issue I would like to ensure that on GCP a GPU node gets properly provisioned and the pod assigned.

Confirmed this is working.
Using the new UI I was able to attach a GPU NAP automatically created a GPU node pool I verified I could import tensorflow and see the GPU
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/129b889>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/129b889</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/files/4163109/pod.txt>pod.txt</denchmark-link>
